title: Great-West logo very wide grotesque
content:
Hello,  
Looking for name of the font used in “Great-West” logo.  
Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080421174832im_/http:/typophile.com/files/greatwestlogo_3652.gif)

 [‹ (x) PikiFX website logo bold script - Eclat {Stephen, Akira}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080421174832/http:/typophile.com/node/44468 "Go to previous forum topic") [National geographic logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080421174832/http:/typophile.com/node/44407 "Go to next forum topic")
author: coronation

comments.content: The digitization is _very_ poor, so this is either a crappy tracing of an existing typeface (maybe Annonce Gothic?) or a custom drawn logo.
No, this isn’t Annonce. Brendel Informatik’s “Quinta” is the crappy tracing of this typeface which tells me its not custom drawn and does exist. Thanks anyways.
